title: Fiddlehack
data:
A nethack variant based on [FIQhack](/wiki/FIQhack "FIQhack"). Some commits come from [Fourk](/wiki/Fourk "Fourk") and [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack").

No online server yet! [Source code](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack)

Lineage: [NetHack\_3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") -> [NetHack\_4](/wiki/NetHack_4 "NetHack 4") -> [FIQhack](/wiki/FIQhack "FIQhack") -> FiddleHack!

## Chronological Changelog

The most recent changes are at the bottom of the page.

### November 2017

- Quaffing blessed [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment") increases Charisma in addition to Int/Wis.
- Racial stats [rejiggered](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/364dc788fee3dde83bfae5ce01e5390ad567da26). Each race can reach 20 (or 18/\*\*) in at least one stat, and each race except for Human has at least one stat that is capped at 16.

| [Race](/wiki/Race "Race")                                      | Str     | Dex | Con | Int | Wis | Cha |
| -------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [Human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)") | 18      | 18  | 18  | 18  | 18  | 20  |
| [Elf](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)")       | 18      | 20  | 16  | 18  | 20  | 18  |
| [Dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") | 18/\*\* | 16  | 20  | 16  | 16  | 18  |
| [Gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") | 16      | 18  | 18  | 20  | 18  | 18  |
| [Orc](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)")       | 18/\*\* | 18  | 18  | 16  | 16  | 16  |

- A wizard wearing a [cornuthaum](/wiki/Cornuthaum "Cornuthaum") gets +1 int and +1 wis in addition to the existing +1 cha. [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/fb67fc669b1cf60234169872b6f5255113adc539)
- Wooden fiddles added. Patches or ideas for magic fiddles welcome! [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/832b8aa96ed59141f5e4d0600056f14aaf94b083)
- Maximum carry cap removed. With sufficient str and con a player may be able to carry as much as 1260 [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight"). [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/dc99ebfdead5e0da85a7eec4cdde84adc4499645)
- (from dynahack) [The Heart of Ahriman](/wiki/The_Heart_of_Ahriman "The Heart of Ahriman") grants [displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement") as well as 1 power regen per turn. When thrown/fired as a projectile, it deals an additional 1d20 damage. [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/b411b2a6494b7d0dea103fdb5531fcec90ba725e)
- Chaotic Wish Improvements: heart of ahriman, and the [Tsurugi](/wiki/Tsurugi "Tsurugi") count as chaotic for the purposes of wishing. Also, [Diana](/wiki/Diana "Diana") counts as an elven bow to make it more appealing to elves. (b411b2a..55156f0)
- (inspired by Fourk) archons and floating eyes glow. floating lights glow a lot. [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/6ec5ecf9c0a9046587d3eeb1b17a798146fa77cb)
- "Racialize" starting inventory. This means each race starts with more stuff, so that from turn 1 each role/race combo hopefully feels a little more different. For instance: dwarves start with booze, gnomes get [oil](/wiki/Oil "Oil") and [grease](/wiki/Grease "Grease") and an [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys"), orcs get meat and poison, humans start with a "canteen" of alignment-based [water](/wiki/Potion_of_water "Potion of water"), and elves always get an instrument.
  - This has been rejiggered a few times, so check u\_init.c if you want to see the latest stuff each race gets.
- Compared to FIQhack, wizard energy-regen and healer regen have been reduced below [XL](/wiki/XL "XL") 11 and increased above XL 11. [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/db319721622b6b79c50d04ec6fab25e9197e7fe1)
- Role [HP](/wiki/HP "HP") cutoff rejiggered. The cutoff is now at level 12 for all roles. To compensate healers, they get 3 hp per level after the cutoff. [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/3e974bbd31726038c271a22cff472fdb57a54fb0)
- Racial HP rejiggered. Humans scale past level 11 better than other races do, and Dwarves get a lot more hit points from 1 to 11. [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/9a58d7218679f5b7d1228be17c25636dd2c0cad6)

| Race[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)                                      | pre-cutoff | post-cutoff | starting |
| -------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------- | ----------- | -------- |
| [Human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)") | d1         | 2           | 2        |
| [Elf](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)")       | d1         | 1           | 1        |
| [Dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") | d5         | 0           | 4        |
| [Gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") | d1         | 0           | 1        |
| [Orc](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)")       | d1         | 0           | 2        |

- (from Fourk) Racial skill boosts. I increased the skill caps for elves in [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow"), dwarves in [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), gnomes in [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow") and [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), and orcs in [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"). More detail in the commit! [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/05dd4b796fa5a2bbe6d6cd720719ed333b92ad2b)
- Fire brand is a scimitar, frost brand is a short sword. Goes well with orcs' racial scimitar skill boost! [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/dcfc13b3c9f6225b8f80b4979b135079717a2a24)
- Rogues can reach Expert [wand skill](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch"), priests and monks can only reach Skilled, Knights and Samurai can only reach Basic. [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/32ab498c0f2ec895cd490570af3911fba236fba2)
- (from Fourk) [Magic\_chests](/wiki/Magic_chest "Magic chest")! Currently magic chests only exist in Castle, VotD, Ludios, Minetown, Sokoban, and the Wizard's Tower. [git](https://github.com/yrmvgh/FiddleHack/commit/4a2d7f9b379100ef63354c2c57f681227fabdef5)
- (from ) \[ git]
